Moreover, the final three episodes feel like the best possible animated realization of these crucial, cataclysmic story beats. Still - maybe the critiques I offer are harsh, yet they come from a place of love. I love Critical Role, the stories they tell, and that 'The legend of Vox Machina' was able to exist at all. Everyone involved should be proud of what they've accomplished; every person with a hand in the creation - the chief CR cast most of all - obviously poured tremendous energy into the production. I think it's a roundly entertaining, deserving venture, one that I'e no qualms about recommending to anyone receptive to fantasy, and animation, that alternates between varying moods, levels of violence, and types of humor.I like the series and recognize what it does well - I just also see where it falters. I think that general audiences would find this a good time, yet also understand that my overall favorable opinion still carries bias that could amount to rose-tinted glasses. Meanwhile, my foreknowledge of Vox Machina canon also arguably limits my enjoyment compared to those watching with fresh eyes. There's no one correct response here - after all, storytelling is an art, and art is subjective. All I can say is that while my expectations for (the first season of) LOVM were perhaps met incompletely, far and away I consider this to be an admirable, landmark endeavor, and I look forward to seeing what comes next.A job well done, everyone. Now - is it Thursday yet?

I am absolutely in love with this show. The witty dialogues, enjoyable twists, relentless action, formidable villains, loveable protagonists, affectionate siblings, loyal friends, lovestruck duos, comic relief, beautiful animation, lovely settings - this show is a complete package! The masterful writing and execution have made this show one of a kind. I would love to see more episodes. Keep them coming, Amazon Prime!

First season was great, but there were a few times it felt a bit too cliche or kind of underwhelming. The voice acting and animation are unmatched and the characters are amazing, but some of the plot and story feels underwhelming in comparison. Still, it has some great moments in the story that are far from average. If you like invincible, I don't see how you could ever not like this as it has a similar vibe in terms of tone and animation, just in a fantasy world. I cannot wait for season 3 and I love that the new storyline is overarching with some season specific elements. Season 1 was an 8.5/10 and season 2 was a 9.5/10.

reviews.review_title: Great potential, a few tweaks for season 2 and this could be magnificent!
reviews.content: I really enjoyed this show and it almost lived up to my expectations. As a fan of the original youtube dungeons and dragons series with Critical Role, I was not disappointed by the return of these characters and their portrayals.A few things I think are the weakest aspects that need to be worked on. The writing, first of all, is the weakest part of the show. They have great characters and the dynamics between them are brilliant, naturally, it's just like the dnd show. But the writing is underwhelming, some of the dialogue is just meh and the plot was also meh and not as interesting as it could have been. I've seen weird reviews on here from uptight people over the crudeness of the jokes and behaviors of characters, the characters are like that originally. They need to improve on the writing massively for season 2, a better fleshed out plot that is split up into episodes in a better way, more realistic and interesting dialogue, and more of a focus on each main character. Please stop making Keyleth save the day every damn time, same with Pike, each character has amazing potential and there was many times another character could have done something to save the gang but you keep defaulting to Keyleth and Pike, they need to work on that predictability for the next season.The next thing they need to work on is the music, while the credits music is the same rhythm as the original theme song, it all needs to be more epic and less underwhelming, I'm looking for some iconic music and a consistent and memorable overarching tone, at the moment the music is very underwhelming and there is no specific character music or Scanlan songs, which were one of the most beloved aspects of the original series Scanlan's songs.Lastly, there needs to be a way for them to make the show stand on its own two feet, while my mother and I who watched it are fans of DnD, the show needs to pay homage and respect to the original series and their characters while also adapting it to newer audiences, it's a hard balance to achieve, but seeing feedback from season 1 should be helpful in achieving that.Overall, it has great potential and I will be watching season 2, hopefully they take what I spoke of into account and make this what it should be, iconic and wonderful. The animation is straight-up incredible, some of the best I've seen, it's flashy and beautiful but not distracting. The voice acting is on point as expected. The character dynamics while not 100% what they should have been, were still incredible. I'd still recommend people watch the show! This review is from a fan that can still enjoy a show and highlight the problems, I'm optimistic for season 2.

reviews.review_title: Like animated shows? Like DnD? This is for you!
reviews.content: This show is simply awesome in so many ways. Based on the Critical Role show which has been streaming on Twitch every Thursday for a couple of years. This show covers their first campaign featuring the infamous band of adventurers known as Vox Machina.Whether you are a long time fan of the show streaming on Twitch or completely new to this you will find that you are easily captured and drawn into this story and the show. There is much to explore for new fans, and a treasure trove of easter eggs and references for old fans.The show full of action, quips, hilarious situations and a great story arc with characters that all have their unique (and sometimes awkward!) personalities. Anyone who has played DnD before will quickly recognize many familiar situations which could probably have happened in your very own DnD sessions.The animation style is beautiful, the creative world that Matthew Mercer designed from his own mind comes into vivid and colorful display in the show.Truly something impressive and fun to watch, and created from the heart by the entire cast.

Ok first i will admit i was turned of by the cursing, and i ask myself why. This anime did not need that at all.Yes its violent no its not for kids, but the characters are fun, and the story is quit good.If you can get pass the cursing and some bad jokes its worth a look.

I like it, but six episodes in, I so wanted to love it. Let's start with the positives, of which there are many!-The plot is compelling.-The diversity and inclusion is seemlessly done, a welcome change in the fantasy genre. Not at all surprising given Critical Role's commitment to being good advocates and allies.-The animation is decent.-The humour is perfectly immature and vile and brilliant.-The voice acting is on point, as you'd expect.-The D&D in-jokes and subtle Critical Role easter eggs are hilarious.The not so good, for me anyway;I haven't been able to get into Campaign One despite trying a few times, and hoped this show would make me finally enjoy it. But if anything, it's made me give up on it for good, and that's frustrating. There's just no getting away from it, the Campaign One characters are almost all stereotypes. I know they're very much loved by fans of C1, but I just find them to be too unoriginal. I only really care about them because I love the cast. They're so stereotypical, they're not the best advert for present day Critical Role which now puts out much more compelling characters.Still, however, a great effort, and I am enjoying it. I'm excited to see each new episode, and hope it gets to run for many seasons. I'm hoping at some point it will find its rhythm and I'll be able to love it.

reviews.review_title: Great show! Would love to see more of this show and this whole genre!
reviews.content: I know there will be more of this show but I truly hope it sparks a new interest in this genre as a whole. The world needs more adult rated anime style cartoons. So tired of the western cartoons being based around whatever a couple cartoonist are doing. There is so much more creativity and differences in the anime of Japan, and I know a lot of people argue 'well just watch japanese anime then' but for me the dubbing or subtitles definitely detract from it's enjoyability. When these types of shows are made for the English audience they are so much better, so please studios of the world please start doing more of this. I also like how they are a storyline rather than western cartoons generally being tune in to whatever episode and be able to follow along. They are made to be watched from beginning to end and develop characters and relationships between them. I also loved the whole bi-sexual dwarf aspect. Super unique and well inserted. Complete contrast from the random black lesbian inserted into the Peacemaker show (although very different shows)

Mystified by the high rating here. Maybe this show only works for committed D&D fans. Certainly it feels like it was written by teenage boys. The language makes it inappropriate for youngsters and the puerile humour and lack of coherent story makes it difficult to watch as an adult. Its well animated, but after 7 episodes I'm done. What a waste of time. By the way I love rick and Morty, archer etc, a lot of animation is well written and genuinely funny. This, on the other hand is garbage.

This show would have been much better if there were only 8 episodes. I enjoyed it until I got to episode 9 and then I just wanted it to be over. I had a hard time staying awake. I had to force myself to finish. Thank goodness the episodes were only 25 mins.I wasn't a fan of the crude overused "adult" jokes either. Yuk! They added nothing to the story and dumbed-down the entire concept.

reviews.review_title: I'm not into D&D and this was outstanding
reviews.content: I had barely heard of critical role before this. It's not something I would watch but this was made by the same people and I decided to give it a chance. This is one of the best animations I have ever seen. It has comedy action Gore in a perfect balance that just works. The animation and voice acting are both did well and Once they start getting to the main plot of the season the story gets real good also. Me and my wife both are looking forward to season 2.

While I am a long time fan of Critical Role I also loved this from just a viewing standpoint. 10/10 on all accounts. Definitely for mature audiences but man is it excellent, and I will tell anyone I can to watch.

Any time that vast majority of reviews are 10/10s you should be suspicious. This is one of those times.This was rough to get through. I am a decent fan of Critical Role. Didn't watch all of the original, but did watch all of campaign 2. The humor and language in this show is unintelligent, vulgar, and juvenile. Exactly, like what a 13 year old boy trying to be edgy would act like, dropping f-bombs every other minute and telling cringe jokes. Its the most immediately annoying aspect, but sadly isn't even the worst offender.While the acting is quite good, the dialogue is quite stiff and predictable. The main characters are cliché and 1-dimensional. For a d&d livestream where you also have the player's real personalities shine through its not a problem. For a show, its a serious problem.The tone is all over the place. It tries to take itself seriously and make us care about the world, only to then crack a silly meta joke and break immersion. The plot is incredibly predictable, and not nearly as intelligent as the rabid Critical Role cultists would make you believe.On a side note, if you do decide to get into watching the Critical Role stream, ignore the fanbase; both the positive and negative. A large portion of the CR fanbase has a seriously unhealthy obsession. They're willing to spend thousands of dollars on the franchise and take the franchise way WAY too seriously. They will quite literally lose their minds if you have any critiques what's so ever, like a cult, hence why I call them cultists (ironic considering in d&d you tend to fight cultists).Is this show the worst thing every made? No. Is it the best thing ever that'll revolutionize the fantasy genre? Hell no. 5/10, and honestly, that's me being nice.

reviews.review_title: A riotous roleplay campaign reimagined, with much to like and a lot to improve
reviews.content: An animated adaptation of Critical Role's Dungeons & Dragons tabletop campaign, The Legend of Vox Machina features the heroic adventures and world-saving exploits of a ragtag band of misfits.Based on what I hear from passionate Critters, the show is to be commended for its faithfulness to the source material. The plot, while not groundbreaking, is well-crafted and includes a diverse set of characters. The animation is excellent and provides the numerous action scenes with the desired vibrancy. Finally, the voice acting is phenomenal and imbues each scene with added pizzazz.However, adapting DnD gameplay does not come without its share of challenges. The reliance on dice limits the logical consistency in storytelling - Vax's lockpicking skill varies wildly, Keyleth's magical abilities are capricious, and Grog goes from taking on everyone at once to being knocked out by a single adversary. An ability to heal even the most potent of injuries and stave off death lowers the stakes severely. The absence of players also needs to be accommodated for by strange constructs ... as in the case of Pike's astral projection. And tropes such as the horny bard and the slow-witted brute abound, typically to the detriment of the narrative.The writing in general is rather underwhelming. Barring Percy, no character gets significant character growth with little time spent on their individual backstories and motivations. The romantic subplot between Vax and Keyleth appears out of the blue and the resolution to Pike's introspection of her faith feels lacking. Another of my gripes is with the dialogue which contains an excess of edgy one-liners and sexual humour, especially in the early episodes.In my opinion, The Legend of Vox Machina is perfect for an audience that is familiar with Critical Role and enjoys DnD. But even someone who generally adores animated fantasy will find the show entertaining. Despite my criticisms, I too shall look forward to watching future seasons ... especially since I am told in no uncertain terms that the best is yet to come!

If there was ever a show that would tell you what was going to happen before it happen this is that show. Just like the title says scooby doo has better writing. This show is such a nightmare there isnt a word to describe how this is bottom of the barrel.So stereotypical this show is. Lets hav a black person have a african accent, and a person with red hair and beard have a irish accent. Wow really bring something innovating.My question is how is it in this would they even have those accents. And why does it have to be those type characters that have those specific accents.In a world where there are animal people, elves, the undead, and so many more they decided to bring that crap into this nightmare of a show.Characters are poorly written.You have this character one min can charm woman, and convince a king to let him and his party help so the kingdom. Seeming like a person who can manipulate and convince people, and the next is a complete idiot who spits out stupid stuff and makes no sense.Not to mention the rest of the squad. One not sure if hes gay or straight
one A religious freak, one who has no self confidence " wow never seen that before " a mother hen who does her best to keep it all together, and another who seeks revenge. The only one who makes sense is the brute of the group he stays consistent. He just wants drink and kill things.

reviews.review_title: A brilliantly original, fun, thoughtful D&D experience
reviews.content: Truly feels like a bunch of idiots sitting around playing D&D while creating a wonderful experience.The voice acting is absolutely incredible while all of the characters feel really different and original.It uses tropes really cleverly, building on them and showing why they exist.I've never watched critical role but I'm definitely going to check them out now.If I could ask for one improvement it would be better animation in some places, this might improve in be second season I haven't got there yet.All in all a charming show that sets out to achieve magic and hits every note perfectly.

If you like fantasy settings, especially DnD, especially Critical Role, you won't be disappointed with this. The animation is good, the voice acting is phenomenal and the characters are generally well-written and relatable.The story moves too fast and is a bit all over the place, in my opinion. To me, it seems more like a party of heroes going on side quests instead of a coherent well-structured story. It's still fun and easy to watch though, if you don't obsess over details.My main problem with the show is that while it advertises itself as an adult show, with so much gore, violence and swearing involved, it does not treat its audience as adults. For example, the "NPCs" are dying left and right, while the plot armor for the main cast is just too thick. There are just too many times when them surviving an encounter doesn't make much sense. And if the writers don't have the guts to kill off a character and end up bringing them back, why kill them in the first place? It has happened 3-4 times already. There's no tension if death means so little and the main characters can cheat it rather easily.TL;DR: It's not among the best shows I've watched, but it doesn't do anything particularly wrong to stop you from enjoying it.

reviews.review_title: Slow but picking up and looking promising
reviews.content: The first two episodes were a bit of a slow start for me.I haven't watched a lot of critical role maybe 20 episodes and only season 1 so this is a new story for me.In the 3rd episode it escalated like crazy.I really hope there will be some political intrigue and a bit less fun as it is sometimes a bit too much but otherwise really enjoying this.Amazingly done CR!

The animation looks good, but that's about all this show has going for it. It's not a D&D show so much as a parody of D&D. The humor is very crass, the characters 2-dimensional, and the plot underdeveloped. The dialogue is a lot of f-bombs - like, more than normal people would think to use even if they were trying - punctuated by an occasional melodramatic soliloquy. Maybe it's the DM in me, but I found myself really wanting these characters to die. But again, the animation is good.

I have followed the original stream for 5years, and this serie is reaching all expectations. Worth the wait. All my friends are as hyped as me.It's all about this group of misfits, all with their own baggage, trying to make it in the world. Love that this can be enjoyed by people who has never seen the stream.

My first complaint is going to be about characters, in the first episode they say they only care about money even though they see all the destruction then they meet a family who they interact with less than a minute then after they fight the dragon they change their mind all of a sudden and decide that it's way too dangerous, and while they're going back they see that family dead and they change their minds again. What the hell is this? I get that these are bad people starting to do good but all that happening in a single episode is ridiculous.And oh my god the writing. It's so messy and all over the place, all lines are either cringe jokes or cringier thoughts of the characters which they say out loud because the writers were too lazy to make us understand their thoughts. They tried calling to make unique characters but failed terribly, there is nothing interesting about the characters. They made bunch of different characters, didn't bother to show us how they meet, and didn't bother to show us what they had in common. One thing i can think of that they have in common is all of them being non complicated and cartoon level stupid.Honestly it's not the most terrible thing but it makes me so mad that they could have made it so much better, i want to be fair so I'll give it a 5.

Critical Role has been able to portray their characters' styles perfectly in this amazing series so far. Anyone who is looking for a fantasy/DnD based series will have a great time watching this show. Keep in mind it is R+18 rated though.
I don't understand why they come up with a good story and great art only to ruin it with 10 year old humour.Some moments were very cringe and annoying. Ruined the beautiful artwork for me.

I know nothing of its source material
I do not like anime any of it, at all.But this was ok
some of the humor was cringe and the story was generic fantasy stuff
There was enough fun to keep me through the first 3 episodes which surprised me
Im afraid it will get to deep into lore and intricacy's of D&D and they will lose their casual audience including me, and that will be that.

reviews.review_title: A New Hope for Fantasy Entertainment
reviews.content: One thing I have to give this show credit for above anything else, is the clear love with which it was made. Every frame is dripping with the passion of not only the original creators, but the animators, designers, composers, background artists, etc. Now passion alone does not make a good show, but combine it with people who are very good at what they do and you can make something truly special. This show will not be for everyone, and that's okay, it isn't meant to be. But for those who enjoy fantasy, D&D, animation, comedy, or those who just want an entertaining romp not bogged down by big studio expectations or the need to fill a content quota, I am confident you will fall in love with these characters and this world as so many have before.And if you don't? That's alright. But for me, a show that isn't for everyone but was made solely because people wanted to make it will always top a show made for everyone that no one asked for.

Before writing mine i read couple other reviews, and yes there is too much swearing but besides that everything is great. Animation is great, the visuals are top of the shelf and give you proper feel of the scene / show. Story is coherent the characters are part of it, getting along, you feel them fighting the obstacles, at some points it is a little bit too abrupt to the point where you get disconnected, but i noticed that in a lot of high quality shows released after 2010, that sometimes they feel like fantasy b class movie, like we need to get to other side of galaxy: 5 minutes later: done.Overall: Great Show to Watch! Standing up to the well established merchandises / lores that were renewed recently and the storie was created for characters.

I appreciate how incredible it is for Critical Role to have this show made in the first place and streamed as a legitimate offering on Amazon Prime. The animation quality is top notch. What CGI they use isn't distracting (*cough* season 2 of AoT *cough*), and all of the designs are really good. The music (score) isn't anything special, but it works. Where the show falls completely flat is the writing. There are so many cliches and cheesy-dumb moments that make it hard to believe in the "awesomeness" of Vox Machina. We're supposed to accept that they're the best despite what we see on-screen. They survive and succeed because the plot needs them to, not because of their actions. Why they're better than the first group that got fried in the opening minutes isn't apparent. Blaming plot armor is an argument you can leverage against a ton of shows, but all of the swagger and winking here highlights it even more. The worst offender in the writing is the adult content -- it's completely amateur. The mere seconds of nudity peppered throughout episodes and the barrage of R-rated language is so juvenile. Even the gore. It's all adult just for the sake of being adult. There's no cleverness to any of it. And that one shot of the turd coming out of that one dude? Seriously? Did they survey a middle school for script ideas? It all feels so unnecessary and amateur, and that's a shame because, without it, Vox Machina could have easily been a show to watch with the family. I know that's not the target audience, but it's not like the adult material is handled with finesse. Another issue is the pacing. I understand that it's hard to adapt 6-years-worth of material into 12 episodes, but it's not necessarily the content itself. Everything is *fine*, but the show obviously wants us to feel something. You can't force us to care about characters we barely know in an arc that just started. That's where the fandom comes into play. They've known the characters for years, so it's different for them. For those of us who are new, it's not as effective. Wrapping up, I just have to point out, Scanlan surviving the fight in S1, ep. 7... he acts like he outwitted the bad guy when he should have been chopped to pieces so many times. And Percival, really? The character is all buildup and no payoff. "If you harm her, I will end you," is so hollow and cheesy, but that kind of represents the show as a whole: all hype, little delivery. It has me interested enough to see where it goes for now, so I'll continue to watch.

Had potential. Was good enough to watch through. But filled with plot armour, cliches, childish adult humor and too much unnecessary swearing. The characters felt one dimensional. Each one of them reminded me of an uncool teenage boy trying to sound cool.

I love D&D, I DM a campaign session almost every week. I haven't watched too much of the Critical Role gameplay because there are only so many hours in a day, but from what I've seen Matt Mercer is an outstanding DM and the players range from amiable to charming. What they've done for the hobby is great.So it pains me to say that the animated show sucks. Look, I'm not ordinarily put off by R-rated stuff. Swearing, violence, sexual content is fine in the right doses. But this was a cringy runaway train of non-stop F-bombs, boobs, butts and splatters written by the creepiest 14 year old from your junior high school days. They over-used that stuff like a crutch, suggesting little confidence in the characters or story by themselves. I know we're not aiming for an Emmy here but it seems like this should have been a lot better.

reviews.review_title: People who play dnd deserve a better show
reviews.content: I've experienced plenty of fantasy in just about ever medium it shows up in, so please don't write off my review as someone who doesn't get it. This show is way too putrid to look appetizing with d&d nostalgia glasses on.The writing is pretentious, characters are flat, the sex jokes all miss. The animation is okay, but minus points for the cgi use. The part I hated the most was the predictability of the plot.The sexual depictions and graphic violence are tasteless. Western fantasy (outside of got) is usually surrounded with an aura of grace, and twisting this into something more grotesque is fun to see. But the idea itself isn't ever enough. Without the effort, everything would turn out like vox.I don't understand how people can give something like this high ratings when amazon prime has invincible.

reviews.review_title: D&D does not translate well to other media (very mild spoilers)
reviews.content:
I'll start with what I liked about he show:
the animation is pretty good (it isn't out-of-this-world or anything like that, but it is as good as it needs to be, maybe a little bit better even).the acting is greatthe main characters are fun, and have lots of great momentsthere are quite a lot of funny quipsNow, for the things I didn't like:
all of the secondary characters are as flat as a sheet of paper. They exist solely to move the plot forward for the main characters (which is to be expected from an adaptation of a D&D campaign)all of the main characters are too... "interesting"? I don't know how to put this, but all of them have a LOT going on in their past. Their party has TWO distinct "mercenaries destined to rule their people", just to give an idea of what I'm talking about. Half of them are built like they are the sole main character of an adventure story. Again, I think this is because they are adapted from a D&D campaignthe villains are clearly built as pure villains and nothing more. They have no redeeming qualities whatsoever, they are there just to be vanquished. They are caricatures of evil, made to be hated universally. Because of this, they end up being not interesting at all, you just end up thinking "shut up and die" every time they show up. Not to repeat myself, but as I see it, this is another consequence of this show being an adaptation of a D&D campaign, where the evil being vanquished is not even the main point of the game, it is just a justification for the adventure to happen for the players.Don't get me wrong, I've watched quite a lot of D&D campaign podcasts and such, and I thin they are very entertaining. They tend to be unpredictable (because of the dice rolls and such) and spontaneous (because of the unpredictability and the ability of the players to just act through all of the events), and that makes them very fun to watch/listen. You end up feeling like you are there, playing D&D with them.When you adapt this kind of media to a TV series, you end up having to throw out these thing I just pointed out, which are (IMO) the things that make this kind of media interesting. The characters, the worldbuilding, the villains, they are all secondary to the spontaneous interactions between the players and/or the GM, and to the dice rolls and the on-the-spot decision making.What you end up with is an average show, with bad-to-average worldbuilding, flat secondary characters and uninteresting villains. I still liked some of the moments, as the main characters have very interesting interactions between themselves, but that was it.

Can't even think of anything else to write about it - it's just stupid and boring. Writing was most likely done by a 12y.o. Dumb kid, and all the jokes were stolen from his even dumber slightly older brother. All of that was forcefully inserted up the rectum of a generic fantasy plot, and then dressed in a colorful generic anime suit.
It's good but there are better out there that have been made over the last couple of years.Invincible, dragon prince, kipo, even Hilda was better written.

Light, but surprisingly interesting serie.Nice and stylish art.Well constructed caracters. Pike and Scanlan are my prefered one.Cliffhagning story.Funny part.Hope they continue the serie for couple of years.

reviews.review_title: If lord of the rings was written by a 14 year old boy
reviews.content: First 10 mins of this show mostly consists of the f bomb, burping, throwing up, gore and sex jokes... feels like I've stared into the mind of an infantile 14 year old boy with an unhealthy obsession with D&D. Not remotely enjoyable, funny or clever.The only people who seem to like this show are those who are well acquainted with the d&d campaign (die hard fans) or are into immature, crude adult humour. If you don't sit in either category, avoid and save yourself time.

I rarely post about animations generally, and animations bordering on medieval fantasy in particular. However, this Amazon Original animated series is the best animated series I've streamed in a very long while...after the stunningly incomparable Castlevania (seasons 1 through 4).The characters are, as described, a band of misfits. The humor is dry, brittle, but punchy. The plotline is straightforward but hair-raising. The action scenes and knife and blood play is fast, deadly and gruesome, and that makes it all the more effective. With elements of otherworldly magic thrown in through the characters and the situations and unnamable vampiric evil they faced, it makes a viewer reminisce all the more of the wildly successful, bloody Castlevania.If you've got time, and you enjoy animations, and fantasy/gothic/horror animations in particular, give this a spin. You WON'T be disappointed.Rating: 10/10.

Why make something for a more mature audience by throwing in gore, a tiny bit of nudity, and lots of language, when the story itself isn't much more than an episode of Scooby Doo? The voice acting is good, the animation isn't bad (it isn't great either), but really the writing is pretty lame. I love adult themed animations, and would like more of it, but this isn't worth the effort to watch.

Ok, let me say why it's a 4,Its not the podcast and I get that, but that's just it, it's NOT the podcast at all. The feel just isn't there. The connection between the characters is so lacking, it's actually unwatchable.And what is up with the getting their butts beat down so much, like they hit the guy once and that's it? It the podcast it was a really good fight, this was just sad. And not having the one guy come out of the closet to help VM was actually a nail in the coffin for me. Pixe was supposed to cast restoration on him and blah blah, none of that.The show feels rushed in the story, I know, a round is 6 seconds in the game and a battle takes only 2-3 full minutes to fight, but it is just, not there.And biggest pi$$ off is Matt isn't doing Gilmore's voice and isn't at all how he should have been drawn.I guess it's my fault, I built up the release so much and it didn't live upto my expectations at all.I really hope the next episodes will change my mind but I highly doubt it.

How the hell does this show have a 9/10 rating on imdb? Am I watching it different or what! Come on, this show is crap, don't you dare compare it to castlevania... there's no iota of world building in it, the dialogues are just annoying, the humour is so bland and forced, this looks nothing like the trailer! Avoid this nonsense! Meaningless violence all over the place.

reviews.review_title: Average until you realize it's D&D
reviews.content: This is an average show with low budget and bad animation and average storytelling until you realize there's a meta scene behind the show with Critical Role and everything being a D&D reference then it's actually kinda cool.

I've listened to literally every Critical Role podcast and truly want these people to do well with this project, however, the direction they're going seems to be deviating from actual people that are going to be watching the show. There is terrible pacing, no set up to give the audience some sort of heads up on why these characters are the way that they are. Like, you can't just have Vax say that he's not magic and then have him throw his belt on the ground and have it become a snake for what appears to be no apparent reason. There's a whole vibe that this is a D&D show, but it's not communicated to the audience at all. Watching this I'm on the same page with Keyleth when she says "Why are we even together?" Seriously, why? There's literally no back story, just bust in 'Here's Guardian's of the Galaxy in the third act, enjoy!' Matt is definitely better than this.

reviews.review_title: How do you wanna do this!
reviews.content: As a fan of Dungeons and Dragons, Critical Role and Fantasy in general I gotta say this has met all my expectations, the crew has really captured the energy of the stream brilliantly.My one bit of criticism is that first 3 episodes have moved at a break neck pace and I can understand why its really got to hit the ground running but I imagine as the show develops it'll take its time when it needs too.

As an avid player of D&D for many years, I was recommended Critical Role numerous times, I tried a few times but could never get into it and would usually lose interest after few episodes. In this format though, the show shines brightly. The characters are great, the voice acting is perfect and the story is engaging. I know that a few people will disapprove of the cursing and adult themes but I actually find it funny (as I believe it's intended to be). Overall great show, hopefully it's picked up for a 2nd season.

reviews.review_title: Quick Enough for Fans, Accessible Enough for Newcomers
reviews.content: The Legend of Vox Machina is a great concept with a great story to tell. Though it may oftentimes lean too much on the irreverence and low-brow humor which permeates its predecessor live show (sometimes, to its detriment), the portrayal of the lovable group of voice actors is certainly true to form in all the ways that count. The individualized characterizations are made clear early on, and the quick pacing and frequent, over-the-top spectacles are more than enough to rope in newcomers to either Critical Role or the D&D fantasy genre as a whole. The animation is crisp during both high intensity combat sequences and slow moments of thoughtfulness. One of the great strengths of the live show was the ability of the cast to freely and expertly play with narrative tension, oscillating between somber moments of dark character exploration and vulnerability, and moments of tenderness and levity. In these first episodes, this show has seemingly found that balance and I hope, as the series progresses, the writers and producers find more ways to more effectively execute on those moments.

Don't waste your time. It's cheesy and predictable in the worst way. The story has so many holes you can drive a truck through them. I couldn't get past ep 4 it insulted my intelligence so bad. Critical Roll is really a leader in the industry? Sad. Really really sad.

From the gorgeous animation, stellar voice acting (obviously), fantastic characters to the gripping fantasy story, Vox Machina is everything we hoped for!Fans of Critical Role will love it, newcomers will enjoy it as well!Bidet!

reviews.review_title: Horrible! Who are you people that gave it 10s?
reviews.content: Are you cowed by some profanity? There's literally nothing to this! Ugh! Why God? Whyyy. And David Tenant? Dude, bro! Pal! Get out now. Don't watch it.

This is the show to start the new year, the writing and world building are amazing and the stories each character bring is Phenomenal. Adult Fantasy shows are some what lacking as there are very few of them around but with Critical Role that could change things for the better allowing many more Adult Fantasy shows to be made.The humor is funny and while some jokes don't land others can cause a roar of laughter, the action is something not to miss as each fight scene is well choreographed and the chemistry of the characters feel natural and like they have known each other for years. A sure not to miss if you enjoy the fantasy genre.

This one is quite hard to review. I like fantasy and D&D so this should be easy, but it's not. There are many issues.The group of heroes. Are they supposed to be good, bad, drunks or fakes? Are they skilled or amateurs? It just doesn't work, there's no explanation no history no nothing. Just random nobodies in a bar fight and then it's of to save the world.Pretty fast we run into the real problem. The story. What happens is we get totally overpowered supermonsters that kill armies with ease. Nothing can hurt them at all. Until suddenly they are easily beaten for no apparent reason. And this is all there is. That is the whole story. First invincible and suddenly easily beaten by a group of randoms who don't know what they are doing.Then we get to the originality. It's great that they wrote this great story and created a cool universe. Or did they? For me it just seems to be bits and pieces stolen from all over the place. The whole universe seems ripped off. They stole stuff from Game of thrones, Witcher, Dragonlance and even from bloody Disenchantment just to mention a few. I know it's hard to be original, but they ain't even trying.

I'm guessing by all the high ratings that some are giving that this is supposed to be a thing. Or was a thing before it got animated. I don't know what that thing was, but I hope it was better in concept than it is in execution, because what I watched was garbage. The juvenile humor is just cringeworthy and the puns and barbs are just not funny. The characters just humiliate themselves whenever they open their mouths and the lovable misfit schtick has been done way better by way more talented creators. But I guess Amazon is desperate to fill streaming time so they will greenlight anything.

Waited so long for this and I am so happy it's finally here. The first 2 episodes were good, but I think we'll see the importance of them in season 2. The 3rd episode was perfection and I can't wait for the 3 next episodes. Is it friday yet ?

The story as of episode 3 so far is good, the animation is average though i understand the budget is the issue with the animation. The story is set before they started streaming so we are getting the backstory from the home game.It is pretty faithful to the original with the original cast/creators behind the animation.It is more adult themed which is a good thing.I say give it a watch and maybe season 2 is going to be better and we get more seasons.

It was an unknown show to me but i am happy i found it. Compelling story and good graphics. Most of the actions made sense does have some plot holes but its fresh in its take and is a good watch.Even the plot holes would be like them attacking the minions rather than the summoner and stuff like that does not really take you out of the experience. Overall was a fun and good experience and them not holding out on the gore was refreshing as well. The gore is not gory for the sake of gory but just gives rise to realism and feels justified. Would rate higher but its not a masterpiece. Good show...

I started watching Critical Role with the second campaign so I'm not fully in the know with the first campaign.I thoroughly enjoyed the first three episodes of this series and it was a really good move making it R rated.This is what can be achieved when a group of friends create a passion project together and a lot can be learned from it. I hope it continues and I'm happy that they can live their dream.

9 episodes in, loving it. Note i have seen all of campaign 1, so may be a bit biased.I'd say it's a hate it or love it. If funding is needed for future seasons sign me up! Acting is amazing, love the style and animation. Nothing out there quite like it!

reviews.review_title: Well done animation with a DnD feel
reviews.content: This show has a little of everything. Wit, gore, adventure, drama. It's bloody, has adult dialogue (not over the top though), and an interesting storyline. Most animated TV shows fail to hold my attention but I'm 3 episodes in and I've enjoyed them all.

Credible, entertaining, and perfectly paced, "The Legend of Vox Machina" on Amazon Prime Video brought with it a small world of creative character-driven storytelling that I've seen abundantly in PC games. Crisp animation, great editing, and superb writing rendered this show a worthy animated series deserving of its own franchise.Remarkable directing by a team of sharp minds - Sung Jin Ahn, Alicia Chan, Young Heller, Stanley Von Medvey, and Yu-Won Pang. Praiseworthy screenplay by Brandon Auman, Marc Bernardin, Ashly Burch, Kevin Burke, Mae Catt, Jennifer Muro, Sam Riegel, Eugene Son, Travis Willingham, and Chris Wyatt.Neal Acree's musical scoring brought a deep sense of immediacy and fun to the show. Todd Raleigh's editing saved it in more ways than one. Superheroic work on art, animation, and VFX.Voice acting was instrumental in conveying the manifold magical splendours of "The Legend of Vox Machina" on Amazon Prime Video.Taliesin Jaffe (as Percy de Rolo) was quite good. Laura Bailey (as Vex'ahlia) was great. Liam O'Brien (as Vax'ildan) was noteworthy. Ashley Johnson (as Pike Trickfoot) was amazing. Marisha Ray (as Keyleth) was superb. Sam Riegel (as Scanlan Shorthalt) was outstanding. Travis Willingham (as Grog Strongjaw) was memorable. It was hard to choose a favourite when each character felt so distinct.All other voice-artists did notable work for various characters in Season 1 of "The Legend of Vox Machina". The villains Silas and Delilah Briarwood (voiced by Matthew Mercer and Grey Griffin) were great. Lesser baddies like Duke Vedmire (voiced by Rory McCann), Professor Anders (voiced by Stephen Root), Kerrion Stonefell (voiced by Darin De Paul), and General Krieg (voiced by David Tennant) were great. Sovereign council member Lady Allura Vysoren (voiced by Indira Varma) was memorable. Archibald Desnay (voiced by Dominic Monaghan) was remarkable.The first season was off to a promising start. Plenty of humour and action, with enough gore and explicit content to keep adult viewers entertained. I loved some of the Steampunk inspirations as well. The characters were well-crafted and their interactions, wholly convincing. The show also contained 'real life' moments - modern swearing, nudity, and more.Despite being an animated series, every episode felt real because of such elements. Some nice "Final Fantasy", "Game Of Thrones", "Lord of the Rings", "The Witcher", and "Dungeons & Dragons" vibes as well. I can't forget to mention the many funny moments that prevailed in this show, imparting perfect humorous balance to an otherwise dark and bloody tale.In the "The Legend of Vox Machina", you'll find an unemployed and disreputable gang of mercenaries faced with the prospect of saving the kingdom of Exandria. Misfits in every way, their quest held great symbolic significance. Not all heroes wear capes, indeed.Critical Role did excellent work creating this masterpiece. The show's almost cinematic fight choreography, outstanding musical scoring, and witty as well as humourous writing more than made it worthy of multiple seasons. That jaw-dropping cliffhanger of a finale included.

reviews.review_title: Great show that borders on excellent at times
reviews.content: I found the show when looking for highly rated animated shows on IMDB and don't really know any of the lore around it. The show is really good, especially the first few episodes that set the stage for the season. I am all about adult animation shows that are not afraid to curse, have violence, and are also LGBTQIA+ inclusive!Vox Machina does struggle from some stale tropes at times. The characters are all pretty typical (the comedian, the stoic, the big dumb nice ogre character, etc.) and many parts of the story could have used some fleshing out. Not enough background is given for some of the characters and, while this has 12 episodes of about 300 minutes total season one length, the show struggles with pacing at times.I believe that the show is well worth a watch and am happy it was picked up for a second season.

reviews.review_title: Not bad , but not very good either
reviews.content: Ok series , but not as good as the current rating suggests in my view .The animation is not impressive .The group of characters is somewhat large , too large for all the characters to really work .A couple are remarkable , but most are somewhat generic .

This show was entertaining to turn on and pass the night, but definitely not my first pick if I had other options. I think the pacing was kind of weird at some points of the show, but I did space out on one or two episodes. I enjoyed the visuals so I bumped my initial rating by a star for that reason, but I wish the story felt less choppy.

Action, drama humour and a lot of gratuitous sex and violence. It does not get better than this.A roller coaster of a show with enough humour and humanity to keep it from taking itself too seriously and yet somehow never compromises the dramatic integrity.Also David Tennant is a *dragon*! 😍

reviews.review_title: Why does this feel like it's made for kids?
reviews.content: They might be cussing and chopping peoples heads off, but everything else feels like it is straight out of a little kids cartoon. Immature characters, silly plot devices and there are even sad musical numbers, wth? I can't get over all of the high ratings from all demographics. I suggest watching an anime like Log Horizon, Re:Zero or even a classic like Inuyasha for comparison, they are on a totally different level of intelligence and well, everything. I am on episode 5 and I think it has been getting a little better, but I doubt that I will force myself to watch the rest? I can recommend it for a sleep aid. I have been watching it at night before I go to bed and it has taken about a week to get through 4 episodes! :)

reviews.review_title: About as mediocre as a story or party of characters can get.
reviews.content: While I appreciate the attempt to modernize fantasy, as well as the inclusion of adult subject matter, the series is just neither intelligently written nor innovative. It truly does come across as a representation of some untalented dungeon master's mediocre fantasy rpg campaign, which I supposed you can at least say is authentic in that way. I wanted to like the series, but honestly, I have more fun rewatching the campy old Advanced Dungeons & Dragons cartoon series, because I found that group of characters more wholesome. The only thing they're missing to make me hate Vox Machina more is a dragonborn character, honestly (I absolutely despise 5th edition due to this inclusion as a core race).

Perfection and I want to see 10 seasons worth of this content! Love the twists and turns, animation is perfect too! And of course the VOA is on point! I laughed, I cried, I stood up and cheered and it's only the first 3 episodes!!

New the world of critical role started watching over cr2 over the pandemic fell in love with the story telling and the actors. This show gave me goosebumps just know how important it is for them and the community. I'd like to rage!!!! Omg prefect can't wait for more.

reviews.review_title: First two episodes are from the home game and they are so much fun!!!
reviews.content: I love this campaign from the start but there were stories untold on Twitch, now we are seeing one of these archs with this first 2 episodes. I Love it!I was one of those who supported this Kickstarter and couldn't be more delighted. I love the animation and the music as well as all the amazing voice actors who are a part of this!This is worth watching even if you have never seen critical role.

reviews.review_title: Adult show with comedy/jokes aimed at little kids.
reviews.content: The animation is fine, the adult content doesn't bother me but the character dialog and interactions leave a lot to be desired. I feel like this was made for adults (with the swearing and violence) but for little kids with the jokes, characters being obnoxious (while explaining something important), and sheer stupidity of all the characters. I'm rolling my eyes several times an episode. I've made it halfway through episode six and I may not finish the show because it's kind of painful to watch. I was giving it a shot hoping that the characters would grow up as the show progressed but it doesn't seem that way. Currently I have no attachment to any of the characters because they aren't very likable. I started watching because of the good reviews but I question their authenticity now. It's not a terrible show but it's not very good either. It definitely doesn't deserve a rating as high as it it.*Edit* I tried to finish episode six but couldn't. I stopped watching it after too many lame jokes. If you stop watching halfway through the first episode to come read some reviews (like I did). Fair warning, it doesn't get better like I thought!

TLOVM is an awesome adaptation of the original show.The fight scenes are great (especially the one in episode 2), the music is gorgeous and the characters are lovable and quircky.The first two epsiodes are a bit fast paced to my liking, but they are a good introduction to the characters and they set up some pretty important things further down the line.It's in episode 3 that the show really takes off though.The characters really get a chance to get into their own and we see how they all thrive and grow togheter.I can honestly say I was upset when episode six ended and I realised I had to wait another week to see the next 3 epsiodes.
I couldn't stand more than five minutes. These longest five minutes ever left me wondering - how the hell can anybody give it 8 stars (or even more)?? Biggest pile of garbage I've seen in ages.

reviews.review_title: love having these characters come to life
reviews.content: I am a huge fan of the critical role campaigns and have watched the first 2 completely, so seeing these characters come to life and be at their beginning again is so lovely to see and especially the Briarwoods look fantastic. The characters look great, the pacing is different, but that is to be expected when going from 4 hour episodes to 25 minute ones, and the side characters are all voiced so wonderfuly.

reviews.review_title: Great, but the swears are unnecessary!
reviews.content: The swearing in this show is too much. It doesnt add anything. I am not agains swears, they add to the fun, but not every every every sentence needs an f word.

reviews.review_title: Perfect for fans but lacking for new viewers
reviews.content: This has everything a critical role fan would love. It heightens the relationships between the characters, is somehow even more likeable (if that could be possible). However, a new viewer may feel the story is rushing past important opportunities missed for character introductions. Until we get past episode three, we can't know for sure how lack of build up for each of the characters will affect the new viewers connection to the characters. One big thing missing is more views of Percy's past which fans have been waiting for. With all of the hype, still, this show gets an A plus from me! It has everything fans are craving for, tons of inside jokes and more to love! Can't wait. They outdid themselves!

Trying to hard to be "cool". I think i would have liked this when i was 12 because of the swearing and fighting but it's stupid for an adult and i guess it's probably rated for people older than 12yo.-

Okay, there is a big difference between a roll playing campaign and a good story. And the first couple of episodes demonstrate this in spades. On top of which they really want to ram the woke crap down your throat. But stick with it. The writing gets a lot better. The woke crap is there, but not quite so bad. A distasteful aside rather than the main course. In fact you can edit it out and suffer disruption to the story at all.

Tapping out at episode 6Gross out humor, shallow cliff notes of beloved characters, bewildering levels of exploding gore, some cartoon balls and breasts, a brief moment of tentacle porn and a little animal death for bonus shock value...not much else is offered.Not only genuinely unwatchable on its own merit, but the lack of any narrative substance in favor of a long string of clunky attempts at shock actually ruined my enjoyment of the source material. I'm only partway through Campaign One and this Amazon mistake quenched my interest in the characters themselves. Should have avoided it since I was really enjoying Critical Role until now.

Its really bad terrible crude humor similar to Andrew dice clay the later years. The jokes are recycled from every other tween comedy. The stories are shallow rip offs of other much better done fantasy shows. Artwork and voice acting is really good.

The tone for this show is all over the place. It tries to ground itself in its lore, only to immediately break any attempt at immersion for a cheap reference. The show relies on a working knowledge of Dungeons and Dragons, all without bothering with any of the licensing. The dialog is middling at best, relying heavily on juvenile humor that seems meant for a 12 year old. It's not awful, but it's certainly not the "masterpiece" other reviews are calling it.

reviews.review_title: A fun animated ride for adults
reviews.content: I've never done DND so I can't comment from that side of things, but this was a fun show.Season one consists of 12 25 minute episodes which tell one of the origin stories of vox machina.The script could be better there's a lot of adult themes so not recommend for small children that aside I'd seen worse when I was a kid.

(Context: I enjoy Sci-Fi, anime, action and adventure, but have little experience with D&D. I watched 4 episodes)The entire plot lacks depth as if someone were making it up on the spot. It's just a linear sequence of (often very random) happenings. There's no build up. Context is introduced suddenly in an attempt to make random scenes make sense, to keep the plot going.Everyone is stupid. The main characters are stupid, reckless and incompetent but survive, whereas the expendables are the same but die. The bad guys are overpowered but never finish off the good guys.It's full of writer's convenience. The action scenes are full of unbelievable "close-shaves", physics-defying stunts and incomprehensible monsters and abilities. The effectiveness of the bad-guy attacks fluctuate conveniently to spare the main characters and the overpowered resilience of the bad-guys reduces conveniently to allow the good guys to defeat them.

reviews.review_title: This is only fun if you're an impressionable teenager
reviews.content: This show is written by amateurs. Luckily for critical role, their fans have poor taste and constantly wear rose-tinted glasses.I went into this show with open arms, I thought I was going to enjoy some DnD fun at last! But what I get is the creeping realization that this title isn't what I hoped for. None of the jokes make me laugh. None of the characters make me root for anyone. It is the animated show of my teenage DnD days, with all the tropes and all the cliches a teenager might fancy. I will be so arrogant to wager that I may have made my characters at least more interesting than these cookie-cutter personalities.With a score of 8.4, as of writing, somebody may mistake this schewed scoring as an indicator of quality. It's not.I know this because they tried making more of the formula with dragon age absolution and it's not working. People notice the bad writing, the inoriginality, when the hype isn't there to cover up the bad things.Hopefully people will wake up and see this for what it is, so that this animation company can go on to do better things because I love their work. Critical Role may be a fun and creative lot, but they can't pull together to do a good story and narrative outside their usual table-top enviroment.Hopefully with season 2 the writers will improve, but considering that the fans set the bar so low I doubt they will.

It's just okay. Started pretty good with the cool dragon storyline but then became very predictable and boring half way through. I liked the voice acting and animation but the dialogue and writing really bring the show down. The high scores are from the D&D dorks but to everyone else this is nothing new or special. Easily skipped or forgotten.When is invincible season 2 coming out???

reviews.review_title: I'm sorry, it's just bad. Really Dissappointing.
reviews.content: First things first - how the hell does this have a 9.0 rating?Honestly, I found out about this series few months ago and I was really excited by idea so I added it in my watchlist and since then waited patiently.And now as it came out I can assure you I didn't see that amount of cringe in series, even in 1 episode for a while.The plot - it does not entertain you. It really feels like a high school improvisational act play - "long long ago there was a great world with magic and abilities and giants etc. And everyone lived peacefully BUT THEN EVIL CAME AND THAT CHANGED EVERYTHING" This is literally almost a quote from the series and it does not hook me at all. Then there's presentation of random team of heroes which eventually getting vanished in 30 seconds by SOME EVIL EVIL. And then there's a jump to some meeting with king (of what?) and his dudes which are discussing how their best heroes sucked and now they need new and better ones. I'm not interested in retelling every second of it so I just tell that right after statement that we need better heroes we are getting teleported to some kind of tavern when we are being intoduced to our main protagonists (Spoiler - their characters are made of a cardboard). Our heroes are took up to a fight, being kicked, thats the most stereotypical bearded trans bull/man/woman/creaturx (of course comes with a f**king undercut) and kicks out heroes. Then they realize they can't cope with each other and ask themselves a question - why are they even together? And then surprisingly one of the characters comes back with a paper with king's announcement and THEN our heroes realize that the only thing that bonds them together is money. Wow. What a great introduction. Literally no words. It was literally 10 mins in and I went through all of this stream of information, and the only info that is truly useful is character's names. Hillarious.Humor - Bad, bad try. Believe me, my sense of humor is broken af and it really made me chuckle a few times, but the rest of my "chuckles" were from serious scenes that supposed to be, you know, serious. Waist majority of jokes is not funny at all, at least for me, because excuse me, I can't handle everlasting flow of penis/vomit/sex/ball jokes, and unfortunately, most of them are like this. Also, huge amount of cursed words only in one episode is just mindblowing, it really feels like I'm watching Dota 2 anime.Characters - as I said before, they are made out of cardboard. You'll barely remember their names at the end of episode, but the thing you WILL remember is their stupid and stereotypical characters - Goofy giant, cynic twins, pervert midget with charisma, some steampunk-ass smart guy with glasses, self-aware druid redhead (which is also the only character with reasonable decisions). That's it. Now, really. We didn't get even king's name. Eventually, we feel nothing for this characters, and when some of them die in the end of episode, AND you see OUR CHARACTERS getting sad about it, it just feels so confusing and out of sense, you just can't get rid of cringe in moments like this.Conclusion - sorry, this story is just not for me at all. I'm sure, someone in the age of 14 or even less might like it, but not me. Story - stupid, characters - stupid, plot - even stupider, motivations - out of words. Knowing how much money did authors raise, they really could have made a better job, at least hire better writers.One episode was enough for me, which is quite rare, for example I watched 3 episodes of new hee man just to give this show a chance, but I will not do that in this time. I am just dissappointed by it, and I'm sorry that it came out like this.

reviews.review_title: D&D animation has been resurrected and is better than ever!
reviews.content: I was excited to hear that this series was coming out. Every dungeon master has thought about having their game become an animated series just like this. The show has completely delivered on what it promised in it's epic kickstarter debut. All the naysayers just want to hate, if you read the 1 star reviews they say give up in the first episode, that's a cop out. You need time to lay out a good story and if you're open minded, it's worthy of your time.The voice acting is great, the animation is adequate, and the story telling is what happens when a group of friends sit around a table and collaborate on something that they all love. Non-D&D players might find it a bit confusing at first, which is understandable. After a few episodes, hopefully, it will inspire you to get out there and join in your first game. Just don't expect every game to be as epic as this one.Show the series some love and it will bring more adventures like these to life. There is so many great stories being told around the table top and The Legends of Vox Machina will open the doors for the rest. <3.

reviews.review_title: ignore the score, this is GOD AWFUL
reviews.content: This has to be the worst animated anything i have ever watched. Please please please save your self the trouble of watching this. I never thought amazon would out netflix, netflix anime. I dont know who they paid to fake these rankings but juist watch the first episode, that will be enough.

reviews.review_title: i love it, i need moree of this!
reviews.content:
I love it, it's everything you could ask for from a fantasy series, finally something worth seeing after so much forced inclusive fiazco like the rings of power and the witcher the origin of blood.He has everything you could ask for:
gore
comedy
dungeons and dragons influence
each character has the moment of it and it is not only set to check inclusion boxes
there is a little bit of sex too
What more could you want?As I was saying, I am very glad to have found this series after so many disappointments this year, I have nothing to criticize, the truth is that I am already writing to reach 600 characters xD.

The genre fantasy has grown exceptionally fast, producing countless masterpieces over the last three decades. Since the first massively multiplayer online role-playing was created, the consept of classes and races, mythological creatures and magic has spawned a new subgenre. This type of series has before been produced in anime, however not as detailed as Vox Machina.Vox Machina truly reflects the numerous ways of experiencing Dungeons & Dragons. From being the silent, and most strategic character to the most impulsive and least to say blaring counterpart.The series gives a humerous yet dramatic and actionfilled display that easily would captivate even the lowest of fantasy-fan.Vox Machina is a series i could recommend to others in fantasy, just as much as i would recommend Full Metal Alchemist Brotherhood in anime.
If you are bored and need some time this is the series for you .Interesting plots and good character development.magic and quest adventuring with how its should be.

reviews.review_title: Polished but missed a few good bits
reviews.content: Obviously can't expect everything from critical roll to be packed into it but it did include, it included it well enough.All said and done it was a good show. Bravo! Glad they didn't tame down the foul language and humor. It was after all funded by the fans on kickstarter, not the casual viewer.It didn't disappoint from the source material.Docked 1 point as some of the dialogue didn't feel as natural as on critical roll leading to bits of disconnect between characters but maybe that's just me being too judgmental after fondly remembering the original show and another point docked because the animation, while good where it counts, seems to take a nose dive on the more slow scenes. Would've been nice to keep the quality up there the entire time and I think that has more to do with lazy animator shortcuts than a lack of budget.

This is a great show that has so much soul.It really makes a difference if a show/movie is made by decicions of a big movie studio or actually by people who love and care for the story, the background and of course the character.The first season was good, it introduced all the characters and had interesting villains... but the second season was just outstanding.Personally i loved everything about it, especially the Grog and Vax stuff, and i can't wait for season 3!The only bad thing is, that the episodes are so short... or the seasons have not enough episodes. I personally hope it gets 5 season, i just don't want to say goodbye to those characters.

reviews.review_title: Zero Risk, By The Books Good vs Evil Borefest Woth Horrendous Writing - Please Read Before Wasting Your Time With This Children's Show
reviews.content: As you can tell by any fan service loving D&D reviewer, if you're the kind of person who likes anything with fan service then you'll probably like this.If you have any appreciation for character development, plot twists, slick dialogue, basically anything that makes the IMDB Top 100 what it is, then avoid like the plague.I really wanted this to work, I didn't even know what Critical Role was, I just saw an 18 rated fantasy animation and thought after The Boys and Invincible that we'd have another Prime gem on our hands. And I forced myself to watch 12 episodes despite wanting to give in within a few.Instead you get a show that repeats itself every episode. Here's the formula; the little purple gnome guy says sex jokes because tee hee sex isn't sex naughty, the garden girl plays the awkward shy character that all geek girls are meant to relate to and just randomly every episode "discovers" a new power that handles the episodes present danger when all else is lost, she then flirts aimlessly with the brother of the twins without it going anywhere because tee hee aren't girls cute, the sister of the twin just sighs and barks order all episode, the guy with the gun is moody all the time and is literally the only character with development, the holy girl I almost forgot she existed, she just personifies goody goody. Then there's the warrior, dear lord, the WORST voice acting and dialogue writing I've encountered in any show, Guardians of the Galaxy literally gave a free template on how to write the funny powerful oath and somehow they just failed in every way imaginable. Every ep he gets angry, swings, gets beat and says something like "ouch that hurty".ZERO risks taken with writing, I was so hyped when Percy's sister randomly gets murdered, I was like here we go, plot development, nope, literally chicken out of her death in 5 minutes, she's back alive because magic lol. Then after the massive battle the garden girl sacrifices herself, FINALLY a main character is killed off for plot development? Nope, literally goes from unsavable to SUDDELNY ALIVE OUT OF NOWEHERE in 5 minutes.Pathetic writing honestly, no character will ever die but a bad person, do not waste your time, it's by the books good vs. Evil, good always wins trash, it might as well be a 12 rated show, there's not even 18 rated content but swearing and tee hee virgin sex. Absolute wasted opportunity writer have no backbone at all, can't even commit to their own plot twists.I literally made an IMDB account to counter these fan service addicts and hopefully save someone's time. Gave it a 2 because the animation is incredible, the animators deserve a 10.

I love the fast-paced, action-filled start. It was very enjoyable to see the teamwork, but sadly the show became way slower. It would be nicer to have fewer episodes. The story is nice, but not great. Overall a fine watch.

reviews.review_title: A DM gives the show two thumbs up.
reviews.content: The main voice acting is voiced by voice actors who have hundreds upon hundreds of emotionally invested voicing hours into thier own specific characters, created and lovingly played by the actors prior to the making of this show. This ensures an absolutely breath taking aural experience by the viewer, which is amplified further if the view has thier own previous listening investment into the Critical Role live play series.Furthering on this, the visual aspects are amazing as well, not to mention the sound track.My only criticism would be the episodes are too short! I would like another 10-20 minutes per episode, but that may just be me being greedy for more and not wanting to stop watching, or maybe I've been broken by listening to the 4 hour episodes of the podcast!

reviews.review_title: Mediocre at best, cringeworthy at worst
reviews.content:
I would skip this tbh weak humour that relies too much on "haha look at the fantasy elf swear fantasy elves shouldnt do that hahah" and other lazy jokes that just rely on balls or dick
Animation is fine and the voice acting is good but its fairly meh.

From the first glance, LoVM basically follows the formula whereby an underappreciated group of protagonists rise up to prominence against all odds. This series however, is certainly more than that.The voice casting was amazing. It felt so passionate and realistic. The comedy was spot on as it was very smart and well thought. The plot arc was straightforward and simple, yet so engaging. This is a dark and mature series thus, viewer's discretion is advised. I love how each character feel like actual individuals rather than stock character archetypes. This is great even if you're not into fantasy. The animation on the other hand is superb.
It's pretty freaking simple, this is just a fun way to kill some time. You will not regret going on the journey! This is top tier story telling. And off the wall fun!

reviews.review_title: Not the Best but Fun to Watch
reviews.content: First 3 episodes of the series has just been released. Lots of hype and very interesting legacy to keep up. Although animation looks a little bit more frame-y for modern equivelents and story is a little bit cheesy, the VOA quality and sincerity and the joy of Critical Role cast would make the fans (and most D&D players) smile time to time. Character Grog and actor Travis Willingham is a typical silly brute, yet funny enough to watch. Scanlan Shorthalt however is a interesting and original, VOA Sam Riegel gives a great performance in the aired episodes. Lots of little easter eggs are hidden for fans of the series. Tl;dr Not the best animation series, but fun to watch.

I cannot believe these crazy nerdy voice actors managed to turn a home game into a animated series and it's actually amazing?!Acting is on point. The episodes should have been 45 minutes each. The animation is crazy the action is great! This went beyond any expectations I had for the show. Can't wait for future seasons!

The main storyline is basically illogical. The main storyline is driven by the mistakes of the protagonists. The character creation is even more difficult to describe. The tavern was obviously portrayed as a group of hidden masters who have experienced many accidents but feel drunk, but later One is more temperamental than the other, and it doesn't look like the kind of bitterness and hatred in their background that they have been for a long time to see through the world.

Terrible! I couldn't even get through half the 1st episode. Shows like this will kill the fantasy-action-adventure genre. Too much swearing....clearly the SCRIPTWRITERS HAVE VERY LIMITED VOCABULARY and command of the English language. Wasn't even funny. Wasn't engaging. Only the animation gives it the 4 stars. Japanese Anime, Flight of Dragons, Dungeons and Dragons (TV), and even Gummi Bears, that came out decades ago have much more to offer than this garbage. BLEH!

reviews.review_title: Don't Trust the Reviews Here, The Show Is Mediocre At Best.
reviews.content: Vox Machina is a show based off of an extremely boring web series called "Critical Role". Where popular voice actors/actresses play Dungeons and Dragons, yet none of them seem to know what theyre doing.This show is filled with cliche after cliche after cliche, the humor is horribly cringe, and the plot seemed to have been written by a 65 year old with no writing experience that has mostly watched Disney movies their entire lives.The first few episodes are incredibly boring and predictable asf; Ragtag group of 7 mercenaries with only one interesting character. Fight dragon terrorizing city, kill dragon, get reward. Make cringe jokes, insert unfunny one-liners. Fight this and that, kill this and that, blah blah blah.It starts to pick up a little bit after, but it's nothing too special.Only reason this show got me interested in all episodes is because of it's main character, Percy. A knock off Harry Potter with a gun. His backstory is actually worth listening to and he's easily the coolest member of the group.All of this, plus the excessive use of cursing so it makes it seem like: "Hey! We're for adults only! If you're a kid, get out!"The animation however, is incredible! Impressively detailed, wonderfully put together movements, colors and emotions. The animation is practically carrying the entire show, in fact I mostly watched Vox Machina just because of it.Overrall, a 6/105.5 points for the wonderful animation..5 for the awful story.

It's only fun if you play D&D and like Critical Role. Taken on it's own merits, it's awful.The world in inconsistent. The characters have no struggle. Every plan they make seems to be "act dumb and hope the baddy will kill themself."All the important things: plot, character arcs, attention to detail, things actually working recognizably like they do in real life, they all have been tossed out the window to make room for jokes about various bodily fluids.So why didn't I rate this lower? Well, I did laugh at one of the jokes, and the animation is pretty good.

New fan here, but I can't wait to get more into CR after seeing only the first three episodes of TLOVM!! The animation is great and the characters are so much fun! And the voice acting from the cast is quality ✨👌 now if you excuse me I'm gonna go rewatch, this time with the Japanese dubs, cause it's too long of a wait for next Friday!!

reviews.review_title: it was worse than I expected...
reviews.content: My boyfriend is a huge fan of Critical Role. He forced me to watch it and said "It'S wAy BetTer tHaN ATLA". He was so wrong.Animation wasn't good, unnecessary cursing, generic plot, violence, bad jokes, nudity. Everything was wrong with it imo.

This animation series is aimed at adults: it's gory, they swear A LOT, it has nudity and excessive alcohol consumption...(if you have a problem with any of these, the show ain't for you)Well, a classic D&D game I would say xDIgnore the bad reviews, most of them complain exactly about what I just wrote, and that it is "too generic". Keep in mind, these ratings have been written after 3 episodes (of 24 total). I know where the story will be roughly going, there is still a lot to come!Does TLoVM invent the fantasy genre "new"? Nah it doesn't. But it's a wonderful adaption of a classic D&D adventure.The Animation is more than beautiful, the voice actors are the icying on the cake.And you don't need to know what Critical Role is, or who the characters are, to enjoy this show. Give it a shot, and judge after seeing more than just 2-3 episodes.

Let me begin by saying I am a huge Critical Role and Vox Machina is my favorite of the three streams they've made so far. The streams are filled with great characters, good humor, and excellent storytelling.The show, however, has none of those things.This was a major letdown for me. Everyone who is giving this more than a 3 star review is either delusional or not familiar with the streams.Let's start with the worst part of it all!First: the jokes.9 out of 10 of them don't land and. They. Are. Constant. I don't believe there's a moment of silence in the show that lasts longer than two seconds. There's never just a moment to breathe or enjoy a quiet interaction between characters before it's interrupted by terrible joke. Now here's the thing, I love crude humor. I find it hilarious. But this feels like the jokes were written by a 13 yr old who just found out what sex and the f word was. Which I find so strange because the jokes on the stream were never like this.
