Now that being said, I have checked out all the episodes and I like what I have seen, been far more engaging than a lot of other shows out there lately and I'm a hardcore sci fi geek/nerd from the 70s/80s, I've been involved in RPGs in some fashion since 1986 when the TMNT RPG come out and shortly thereafter started playing the 2nd edition DND followed by the 3rd edition DND and currently the 5th edition DND (3.5 and 4th editions we won't discuss here, just suffice to say a disappointment on an epic scale).Most of the DND games reflect the real world in terms of language, subtle and mature, the fact I did not know about the Critical Role group itself until recently thanks to a friend of mine and fellow RP/DM (Role Player / Dungeon Master for the uneducated) showing me some of their videos and I myself am starting to watch their videos from their beginning campaign and I swear it is like they have a satellite truck parked outside observing our games or something from over the years LOL.Now yes admittedly because of the pandemic, work schedules and personal lives, the lot of us had not been doing a lot of in person gaming, we only got together again about 6 months ago via the program Discord and started a real, true old fashioned campaign again and seeing this show gives me hope that all us nerds everywhere have a beacon to cheer and see ourselves reflected in each character of the show. It is beautifully done on what I see and I would like to see more.... a lot more.
I really really enjoy this series..what an amazing surprise..i recommend it to everyone especially more mature ages.the action , the lines , the animation were amazing.

Effortless group dynamic with a good mix of heart, laughs and epic fantasy adventure battles. They've somehow managed to capture the feeling of playing D&D around the table with friends. Hooked after the first 3 episode and can't wait for the rest.
Eine der besten Anime Serien 👍 cool, genial, witzig, unterhaltsam, blutig und absolut toll gemacht 😎 klare Empfehlung. Bitte weiter so 👍..........................................
The storyline is great and the jokes don't fail to make me laugh.The first episodes seem a bit slow for the amount of time but it really develops in the briarwood arc.
A good show with excellent voice acting and animations, the writing and plot is very well thought out.It's funny, dark, deep, wholesome and relatable on many levels.Would recommend 100% for D&D fans.

At the time of writing this review this show has a 8.7 average. I predict that has to do with it getting good reviews from D&D fans or something. The plot is okay, the characters are written in a certain way I guess. But the dialoque is easily worth a 2 or less. The characters literrally converse with not even half a second pauses in between and the intonation doesn't sound right at all when a character reacts to someone/something. I predict that when this show hits the masses the score will drop significantly. And for the people that grade this show high i recommend some proper fantasy anime or for example Arcane on "the other streaming service" to go watch that and compare.

Absolutely amazing. This show has been a roller-coaster full of emotions. I'm not gonna spoil this amazing master piece, but if you're looking for an adult fantasy series full of action, sex, comedy fighting then this is the show for you! I loved every part of this story! The characters are gold. I hope to see more of this in the future!!

reviews.review_title: Incredibly fun and well written story we need more of
reviews.content: The Legend of Vox Machina is an incredibly well written story with a clear plot, defined arcs, character development, like-able characters that you want to know more about, and fun and entertaining interactions amongst them.It has something for everyone; driven-story, action, adventure, comedy, adult humor, horror, interactions between characters, dnd jokes and Easter eggs, lots of lore and mythology. Empowered female characters, healthy relationships and friendships, and lots of heroism.Honestly the show is great in every way, I'd say it's not a show for young children because of a couple scenes of adult imagery and innuendoes. However it does what it does best tell an amazing action fantasy story with fun and comedy at healthy doses.I wholeheartedly hope they do MANY MORE seasons they can easily do 4 or 5 more with all the plot and storylines from critical role's campaign.

reviews.review_title: Adapting to animation the right way
reviews.content: Hopefully this will finally show Hollywood that the fantasy genre is definitely worth it if don't the right way. Let the content creators run it and don't get in the way. I hope that this pages the way for great fantasy adaptations.

reviews.review_title: Very fun from start to finish
reviews.content: As the subject says, very fun.For the quick.This felt like an animated dnd game. Well done fight scenes, cheeesy one liners, and most importantly, Loot.Can't wait for season 2.For the less quick, from Scanlon using his bard spells to Grog's barbarian rage I could almost hear the dice rolls hitting the table. The paladin wasn't too much and the little romance will they/won't they didn't become tired. I was invested until the end.Now the elephant in the room, Percy.I liked his story, I liked how it concluded. I'm glad it ended the way it did and I'm glad they ended they did."well goddamn" - Percy.

Amazing story, incredible voice acting, top tier animation. It is probably my favourite animated series of all time, due to the high quality across the noardA wonderful adaptation of the Critical Role Campaign 1 Briarwood arc. It seems to balance the urgency needed to carry a twenty minutes per episode animated series in terms of storytelling with the details fans of the Dungeons and Dragons stream wanted to see.I watched it as a Critter (CR fan), my wife watched it as a newcomer to the world and we both love it. On our 3rd watch through and can't wait for season 2 and beyond.Cannot rate it highly enough, great job!
This is one of the best original programs Amazon has released. Fantastic. Like most series, it takes a few episodes to hit is stride, but the end is fantastic. Highly recommended!

reviews.review_title: "You'll probably know at a glance whether this'll be your thing or not."
reviews.content: This is an Amazon show adapted from Critical Role: Campaign I, probably the touchstone of this recent wave of Twitch and YouTube D&D shows, emblematic of the game's resurgence in the late 2010s.It's crazy how much the liveness and hard-line game aspects of the original show made that experience. That sense that the story could go anywhere and that it's even happening is a miracle of improv talent. The spontaneous banter and creator personality that would leak into the project. Shows don't usually have their own cast members gasping at plot twists as they happen, and that's something special.Not knocking that original story by any means, even if I always thought that the cast was better than the material (LA by Night is an example of better storytelling done in the same format by partially the same crew). This simplifies, rushes and takes all subtlety out of most of the quieter characterisation essential to investment in the action and freeing the cast from just being two-dimensional archetypes. Mercer's voice as a worldbuilder quite literally gets lost. The bulk of this adapts easily his worst arc back when Vox Machina was at their most unlikeable.Scanlan goes from the best to the worst character in the group, even if Riegel (especially early gross-out humour Riegel) antics were never going to translate well to animated television. The adaptation's biggest problem is that sometimes it doesn't want to be for children, and sometimes it doesn't want to be for adults, and sometimes in the same beat.But it's still fun and obviously a fanservice-y but very professionally made passion project with solid pacing and character design. Legitimately monumental that it even came together. Has very comparable production value to Invincible's first season. It's hard to complain, and it's refreshing to watch a Critical Role plot I can actually follow after Exandria Unlimited & Campaign III. You'll probably know at a glance whether this'll be your thing or not.If this very niche property or the game of D&D interests you at all, start with Campaign II or one of the one-shots. I'll always owe it for getting me started on the only thing I love more than film.

An example of excellent animation and story telling. The voice over acting has a quality of actors truly engaged in the content of the story.Highly recommend for anyone that likes great animation and fantasy.

An amazing journey for Critical Role from being a home game a little over 6 years ago no to being their own company, creating their own comics and merch based around their original home characters to raising over 11million dollars on Kickstarter when their goal was only 800 000. Insane, truly insane and amazing that something like this exists.The acting and writing are phenomenal. I see some reviews saying that some of the humor is cringe, I can see where they are coming from but that is sort of the essence of critical role in a nutshell. Hilarious? Yes. Cringe moments? Yes. Moments of heartbreak and darkness? Yes.Its essentially a home DnD campaign adapted to animation and there will be all the hilariousness, raunchiness, awkwardness and fowl language that would be in a real Campaign. I, personally think they captured it beautifully.Its not perfect though. I can why someone who does not know DnD, or Critical Role for that matter may find it a bit unapproachable.There is this inside joke they do in the show that Critical Role cast cannot deal with doors in any DnD scenario and there are a couple of animated scenes that have that as a focus. From an outside perspective you many think this is strange or "cringe" which is fair. I also saw in a couple reviews that the world building is rushed and I'd have to agree with that as well. The world is beautiful but it may be confusing just dropping someone who does not know these characters or world right into the action with little explanation, may make the buy in a little more difficult for you.That being said though I hope this show goes on for a long time and many people watch it because it really is an amazing show with amazing characters and I hope they are able to keep the new comers watching because we could always use more Critters!! Happy watching everyone!

reviews.review_title: Story moves in all the right places.
reviews.content: The best original storyline in animated adult epic by far!!!! Every episode ft like a cliff hanger. The acting was also compelling. We need season 2 ASAP. Great job for giving us this content Amazon studios!!!!

Prepare for a lot of barfing, pissjokes, burping and inappropriate sex jokes because this is just another Western Cartoon that is allowed to portray mature rated stuff in animation and hence goas overboard with swearing in order to create a show nobody really wants to like.I gave em stars because they are ripping of the Korra Artstyle.

Vox Machina is a very enjoyable fantasy for the most part; plenty of diverse characters, plenty of Dungeons and Dragons, plenty of magic. The musical numbers are a bit out of place although the voices aren't bad. Despite the overuse of foul language, the dialogue is a quite juvenile. I think Travis Willingham has the worst English accent I've ever heard. He sounds like maybe a Texan trying to do an English accent. Why on earth would you have him do an accent he obviously can't do when the character doesn't need to have any accent at all? He must have used Dick Van Dyke's Bert the chimney sweep as his model.

reviews.review_title: I made an account for this.
reviews.content: I'm a fan of Critical Role. Not a die hard balls-to-wall-critter-obsessive but I've seen pretty much all of the campaigns over the years and I like the cast and crew.Beware this contains show spoilers.....Seriously though... SPOILERS....I think even without that prior fan knowledge, this show is good... Good, but not amazing. It definitely has its miss-steps, it's weaker characteristics and weaker episodes.Character wise I really like what they've done with Vex'ahlia, Percy, and even Pike by filling in her time away from the table.Vax'ildan doesn't have a personality or characterisation, and Keyleths only characterisation is only 'I can't do magic very well until every screams at me, and then I end the fight' which is super two-dimensional.And Grog and Scanlan are bad. They are two of my favourite characters piloted by two of my favourite players, but they leaned super hard into them as comic relief which has made them into caricatures of the characters in the live play campaign. They still have some good moments, but both are a let down imo.I feel like story was finding it's feet throughout the run though, the first two episodes were bad, the pacing was all over the place, as was the narrative, the stakes and well... Everything, it was a breakneck pace to wrap up krieg and position them as protectors if the realm that didn't stop to actually tell it's story.But from episode 3 it gets pretty much better and better. Still a few teething problems and missteps along the way, but the Briarwood arc was badass. The wraiths in episode 4 were a particular highlight, as well as the sheer brutality of the undead giants, and the silver tongue fight... And our first glimpse of No-Mercy Percy gunning down Stonefell.I don't think it's a 10/10 that knocked it out if the park like many reviews. And to be fair I understand the people who've given it a 1/10 because they don't like gross-out humour sex-jokes and swearing. That's a personal taste that's going to offend some people.But overall I think it's a solid opening season, and that if they can improve upon it moving into the Chroma Conclave arc, then it has all the trappings of a great series waiting to grow into itself.

Its like Friends. But with more fantasy. And nudity. And swearing.In conclusion: its just awesome!Also, when the show is done. You can follow all the same characters in their RP sessions.And Gina Torres is also in it!
